page.title: 01Coast East of Cayton
page.content: The 3 km long stretch of coast is dominated by 200-300 ft high cliffs. The intertidal area is rocky. In places the cliffs are broken and vegetated. Farming uses the largest area (except for sea) of mixed arable and dairy, and there are several farms. Caravan and holiday village development cover nearly as much land and most residents will be involved in catering to the needs of the many summer visitors. Tourism is therefore most important economically as visitors come to enjoy the coastal scenery and nearby beaches, as well as the facilities provided on the camps; all that is necessary for self catering holidays, as well as a pool, amusements, pub etc. The Cleveland Way long distance footpath passes through the area.
